Author: RyanGWU82
Content: Well of course it did, "Web 2.0" didn't hardly exist in 2005. Tim O'Reilly's summary of Web 2.0 was written on the last day of September, and pg's essay was in November. The Web 2.0 concepts were out there earlier, of course, but there wasn't really an idea of a "Web 2.0 startup" for most of 2005.

Author: dfranke
Content: They need to talk to Outlook, so it's probably the best they can do.  The better .NET languages like F# don't seem to be mature enough yet for production use.
